intro: Cristaria wilczekii, commonly known as the Wilczek's crista, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, ornate inflorescence that resembles a crown, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its delicate, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, Cristaria wilczekii is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
